group_works.title: Beyond the edge: professionals at play

results.title: Big Eildon story
results.brief_description: The story of Big Eildon, the largest earthern dam in the Southern Hemisphere; the need for electric power and water for Victoria’s rapidly developing rural and secondary industries; plans by State authorities to harness the waters of the Goulburn River; the story of the people who lived, toiled and built the dam, their plans, their work, their leisure and finally their grand achievements; what Big Eildon means to the people of Victoria and the Goulburn Valley in particular. No other credits available.

results.title: Big Eildon
results.brief_description: The film conveys a vivid impression of the extent of the vast engineering project being undertaken to enlarge the Eildon Dam to nine times its former storage capacity. Working night and day, heavy earth moving equipment is transforming the countryside, building a dam which will provide irrigation water for the Goulburn Valley and hydro-electric power for use throughout Victoria. No other credits available.

results.title: Big city 1980
results.brief_description: In Big City 1980, host Garry Moore presents a discussion on how big cities might be seen in the future by contrasting two cities in the present, Brasilia and the redeveloping city of Philadelphia. The highlight of this program is the amazing futurist city of Brasilia, the capital of Brazil. This instant city was entirely built in a period of 5 years. Every street is an expressway and underpasses eliminate the use of intersections. It is a capital city where government buildings dominate, so this allows a unity in futurist architecture throughout, which looks like a giant set for a science fiction film. Important footage of the city is shown during its development stages. Lucio Costa won the competition for Brasilia’s master plan and Oscar Niemeyer designed the major government building. America’s first planned city of Philadelphia is also profiled along with the controversial plans of redevelopment, which will see the city into the future. Plans made by architects and designers of futurist cities are also shown towards the end of the program. This program was presented on the Tomorrow series by CBS News.

results.title: Big brown beastie, big brown face
results.brief_description: Film about Bill Roycroft, world famous Australian horseman who has represented Australia in five Olympic games. Tells of his life with horses and competition riding and shows him at a dressage event in Canada. Also covers the Australian Equestrian Team at the Montreal Olympic Games in 1976. Princess Anne appears in a dressage event at the games. Title music by Mike Oldfield. No other credits available.

results.title: Big Ben
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and British Movietone News
results.brief_description: The centenary of Big Ben and the history behind the famous chime. Prints from old editions of the “Illustrated London News” recall the casting and installation of the bell. Its significance as a symbol of hope during wartime is illustrated by a series of interviews. Commentary by James Mason.

results.title: Bicycle stall in Malaysia
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson, Educational Media Australia and John Gray
results.brief_description: Overviews the role of the bicycle by focusing on a family who earn their living by selling soup from a bycicle stall. The bicycle is also used as a means of transport for people and goods.
